memberdef.definition: typedef DecisionTree<FitnessFunction, NumericSplitType, CategoricalSplitType, DimensionSelectionType> DecisionTreeType
memberdef.name: DecisionTreeType

briefdescription.para: Allow access to the underlying decision tree type.
The average gain of the forest.
The trees in the forest.
Construct the random forest without any training or specifying the number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: Predict() will throw an exception until Train() is called.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &dataset, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const arma::rowvec &weights, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: RandomForest

briefdescription.para: Create a random forest, training on the given weighted labeled training data with the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize parameter is given to each individual decision tree during tree building.

parameterdescription.para: Weights (importances) of each point in the dataset.
Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &dataset, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: RandomForest

briefdescription.para: Create a random forest, training on the given labeled training data with the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize and minimumGainSplit parameters are given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions.

parameterdescription.para: Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &dataset, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const arma::rowvec &weights, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: RandomForest

briefdescription.para: Create a random forest, training on the given weighted labeled training data with the given dataset info and the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize and minimumGainSplit parameters are given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions. This can be used for categorical weighted training.

parameterdescription.para: Weights (importances) of each point in the dataset.
Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &dataset, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: RandomForest

briefdescription.para: Create a random forest, training on the given labeled training data with the given dataset info and the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize and minimumGainSplit parameters are given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions. This constructor can be used to train on categorical data.

parameterdescription.para: Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.

briefdescription.para: Predict the classes of each point in the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: If the random forest has not been trained, this will throw an exception.

parameterdescription.para: Output predictions for each point in the dataset.

briefdescription.para: Predict the classes of each point in the given dataset, also returning the predicted class probabilities for each point.

detaileddescription.para: If the random forest has not been trained, this will throw an exception.

parameterdescription.para: Output predictions for each point in the dataset.
Output matrix of class probabilities for each point.

briefdescription.para: Predict the class of the given point.

detaileddescription.para: If the random forest has not been trained, this will throw an exception.

briefdescription.para: Predict the class of the given point and return the predicted class probabilities for each class.

detaileddescription.para: If the random forest has not been trained, this will throw an exception.

parameterdescription.para: size_t to store predicted class in.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of trees in the forest.
Serialize the random forest.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const arma::rowvec &weights, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, const bool warmStart=false, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Train the random forest on the given weighted labeled training data with the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize and minimumGainSplit parameters are given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions.

parameterdescription.para: Weights (importances) of each point in the dataset.
Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.
When set to true, it adds numTrees new trees to the existing random forest else a new forest is trained from scratch.

simplesect.para: The average entropy of all the decision trees trained under forest.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, const bool warmStart=false, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Train the random forest on the given labeled training data with the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize and minimumGainSplit parameters are given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions.

parameterdescription.para: Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.
When set to true, it adds numTrees new trees to the existing random forest otherwise a new forest is trained from scratch.

simplesect.para: The average entropy of all the decision trees trained under forest.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const arma::rowvec &weights, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, const bool warmStart=false, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Train the random forest on the given weighted labeled training data with the given dataset info and the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize and minimumGainSplit parameters are given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions. This overload can be used for categorical weighted training.

parameterdescription.para: Weights (importances) of each point in the dataset.
Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.
When set to true, it adds numTrees new trees to the existing random forest else a new forest is trained from scratch.

simplesect.para: The average entropy of all the decision trees trained under forest.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const size_t numTrees=20, const size_t minimumLeafSize=1, const double minimumGainSplit=1e-7, const size_t maximumDepth=0, const bool warmStart=false, DimensionSelectionType dimensionSelector=DimensionSelectionType())
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Train the random forest on the given labeled training data with the given dataset info and the given number of trees.

detaileddescription.para: The minimumLeafSize parameter is given to each individual decision tree during tree building. Optionally, you may specify a DimensionSelectionType to set parameters for the strategy used to choose dimensions. This overload can be used to train on categorical data.

parameterdescription.para: Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each tree's leaf nodes.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.
When set to true, it adds numTrees new trees to the existing random forest else a new forest is trained from scratch.

simplesect.para: The average entropy of all the decision trees trained under forest.

briefdescription.para: Modify a tree in the forest (be careful!).
Access a tree in the forest.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const arma::Row< size_t > &labels, const size_t numClasses, const arma::rowvec &weights, const size_t numTrees, const size_t minimumLeafSize, const double minimumGainSplit, const size_t maximumDepth, DimensionSelectionType &dimensionSelector, const bool warmStart=false)
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Perform the training of the decision tree.

detaileddescription.para: The template bool parameters control whether or not the datasetInfo or weights arguments should be ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Dimension information for the dataset (may be ignored).
Number of classes in the dataset.
Weights for each point in the dataset (may be ignored).
Number of trees in the forest.
Minimum number of points in each leaf node.
Minimum gain for splitting a decision tree node.
When set to true, it fits new trees and add them to the previous forest else a new forest is trained from scratch.
Whether or not to use the weights parameter.
Whether or not to use the datasetInfo parameter.
The type of data matrix (i.e. arma::mat).

simplesect.para: The average entropy of all the decision trees trained under forest.

briefdescription.para: The RandomForest class provides an implementation of random forests, described in Breiman's seminal paper:
